question.content: The Swadesh Darshan Scheme (SDS) which was launched in 2014-15 by the Ministry of Tourism, Government of India, has been revamped as in 2023.

solution.content: Swadesh Darshan 2.0 (SD2.0). It seeks to attain "Aatmanirbhar Bharat" with the mantra of 'vocal for local'.

question.content: Which age group of the population are covered under the Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana (DDU-GKY) scheme of the Government of India?

solution.content: 15 to 35 years. Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalyaya Yojana (Launch 2014): It is a demand-driven placement linked skill training initiative working under the National Rural Livelihood Mission (NRLM). Scheme was announced by the Ministry of Rural Development on Antyodaya Divas.

question.content: What is the name of the scheme launched by the Himachal Pradesh government for dairy farmers?

solution.content: Sanjeevani: This project uses telemedicine and technology to provide convenient and high-quality livestock care services to farmers.

question.content: In which year was the Training of Rural Youth for Self Employment (TRYSEM) scheme launched by the Government of India?

solution.content: 1979. Objectives of TRYSEM: To provide rural youth (18-35 years) from families below the poverty line with training and technical skills to enable them to take up self-employment in agriculture, industry, services and business activities.

question.content: Under the Chief Minister Learn and Earn Scheme of Madhya Pradesh, the government will NOT provide which of the following?

solution.content: Laptops. Learn and Earn scheme: The important aspect of this learn-and-earn scheme is that along with learning skills, the youth will also be given an allowance of Rs 8,000 to 10,000 a month.

question.content: Which of the following statements are correct regarding the Power Sector's Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme? 1) The Prime Minister launched the Ministry of Power's flagship Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme in 2022. 2) This scheme is aimed at improving the operational efficiencies and financial sustainability of distribution companies. 3) From FY 2022-23 to FY 2027-28, the scheme aims to provide financial assistance to DISCOMs 4) This scheme proposes to provide 25 crore Smart Prepaid meters to consumers all over the country.

solution.content: 1, 2 and 4. The Prime Minister launched the Ministry of Power's flagship Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme with an outlay of Rs.3,03,758 crore over a period of five years from FY 2021-22 to FY 2025-26.

question.content: Under which scheme of Airport Authority of India did the Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor inaugurate UMEED Market Place at Srinagar international airport for supporting local art and artisans of Self Help Groups of J&K Rural Livelihood Mission?

solution.content: AVSAR Scheme - Airport as Venue for Skilled Artisans Of The Region. launched in 2022.

question.content: What is the name of the scheme launched by the Uttar Pradesh government to boost milk production?

solution.content: Nand Baba Milk Mission. Scheme to increase milk production: Rashtriya Gokul Mission (2014), National Dairy Plan-I, Central Herd Registration Scheme. Father of White Revolution in India - Verghese Kurien.

question.content: The Swarna Jayanti Shahari Rojgar Yojana (SJSRY) was launched in the year by the Government of India.

solution.content: 1997. SJSRY: The Swarna Jayanti Shahari Rozgar Yojana (SJSRY) shall seek to provide gainful employment to the urban unemployed. Ministry Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs.

question.content: Which of the following has initiated the Village Defence Guards scheme to instil a sense of self protection and ensure the safety and security of villages and infrastructural installations in and around the villages?

solution.content: Jammu and Kashmir. The persons leading the Village Defence Guards will be paid Rs 4,500 per month by the government.

question.content: The Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Rojgar Abhiyaan (PMGKRA) was launched in the year 2020 by which Ministry of Government of India?

options.text: Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways
Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises

solution.content: Ministry of Rural Development. It was for a period of 125 days with a resource envelope of Rs.50,000 crore, to boost employment and livelihood opportunities for returnee migrant workers and similarly affected workers in the rural area, in the wake of COVID-19 pandemic. It will run for 125 days in 116 districts across six states Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Jharkhand, Odisha and Rajasthan.

question.content: In which year was the Pradhan Mantri Rojgar Protsahan (PMRPY) launched? Yojana

solution.content: 2016. PMRPY: a scheme to incentivise employers registered with the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) for job creation. Administered by The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO). Nodal Ministry Ministry of Labour and Employment.

question.content: Which of the following options best describes the purpose of Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Mann-Dhan (PM-SYM) scheme, 2019?

options.text: Provide healthcare services to pregnant women
Provide education loans to financially weak students
Provide pension to unorganized sector workers
Provide financial assistance to small and marginal farmers

answer: Provide pension to unorganized sector workers

solution.content: Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Maan Dhan (PM-SYM) scheme The scheme provides a monthly pension of Rs. 3000/- to subscribers after they attain the age of 60 years. The scheme is for the age group of 18-40 years.

question.content: According to the Mukhyamantri Ladli Behna Yojana, which of the following is NOT the correct eligibility?

options.text: Should be belonging to Madhya Pradesh
Candidates can be married, widowed or divorced women
Annual family income should be below 4.50 Lakh

answer: Annual family income should be below 4.50 Lakh

solution.content: Mukhyamantri Ladli Behna Yojana: Madhya Pradesh Government announced the implementation of "Mukhyamantri Ladli Behna Yojana" on 28 January 2023.

question.content: government Which of the schemes subsidised food grains to poor households in India? following provides

options.text: Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana

answer: Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana

solution.content: Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana (2020). Scheme aims to provide 5 kg of grains (wheat or rice) for free to each individual who is covered under National Food Security Act, 2013.

question.content: The Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana (PMJDY) was placed in the Guinness Book of World Records for which of the following achievements?

options.text: Opening the largest number of bank accounts in one month
Opening the largest number of bank accounts in one week
Opening the largest number of bank accounts in one fortnight
Opening the largest number of bank accounts in one day

answer: Opening the largest number of bank accounts in one week

solution.content: . PMJDY (2014). A National Mission for financial inclusion. Benefits- free accident insurance coverage of Rs. 2 lakh, an overdraft facility up to Rs. 10,000 to eligible account holders.

question.content: Safeguarding India's Intangible Cultural Heritage and Diverse Cultural Traditions of India' is a scheme of which Ministry of the Government of India?

solution.content: Ministry of Culture. Schemes under the Ministry of Culture: Cultural Function & Production Grant, National Mission on Libraries, Scheme for Promotion of Culture of Science (SPOCS).

question.content: Which of the following initiatives of the Government of India is aimed at developing and rejuvenating 75 water bodies in each district of the country as a part of the celebration of Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav?

solution.content: Mission Amrit Sarovar. With a view to conserve water for the future this Mission launched on 24th April, 2022.

question.content: Which of the following components is NOT related to the New India Literacy Programme?

solution.content: Implementation during five years from the FYs 2022-23 to 2026-27. Aim - Aims to cover a target of 5.00 crore non-literates in the age group of 15 years and above. The scheme has five components Foundational Literacy and Numeracy, Critical Life Skills,Vocational Skills Development, Basic Education and Continuing Education.

question.content: Name the campaign launched by the Madhya Pradesh government on the occasion of National Girl Child Day on January 24, 2021, under the 'Beti Bachao Beti Padhao' scheme.

solution.content: PANKH Abhiyan. PANKH (Protection, Awareness, Nutrition, Knowledge, and Health) Abhiyan was launched for a year (2021-22) to aid in the holistic development of the girl child.

question.content: Which of the following is the largest pan-India scheme to strengthen health care infrastructure across the country with focus on primary, secondary and tertiary care services?

solution.content: PM-ABHIM (Prime Minister Ayushman Bharat Health Infrastructure Mission): Ministry (Ministry of Health and Family Welfare), launched (October 2021).

question.content: The 'Right to Work' plan, under the National Rural Employment Guarantee Act, 2005, was implemented in how many districts in the first phase?

solution.content: 200. National Rural Employment Guarantee Act, 2005 (NREGA): It is under the Ministry of Rural development. In (2009), the NREGA scheme was renamed as the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) scheme. Aim to ensure that if any adult member of a rural household is willing to do unskilled manual work, that household gets at least 100 days of jobs in a financial year.

question.content: What is the priority zone of the AMRUT (Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation) mission, which was launched by the Government of India in 2015?

solution.content: Water supply followed by sewerage. AMRUT: Launched on 25th June 2015 and selected 500 cities and towns to focus on development of basic infrastructure. National Heritage City Development And Augmentation Yojana (HRIDAY) started on 21 January 2015,

question.content: When was the Smart Cities Mission launched in India?

solution.content: 2015. Smart Cities Mission: Launched by Narendra Modi. Other important schemes and their launch date: The Jan Dhan Yojna (August 28, 2014), Skill India Mission (July 15th, 2015), Mission Swachh Bharat (2nd of October, 2014), Sansad Adarsh Gram Yojana (11th of October, 2014).

question.content: What is the name of the flagship program that was launched in 2005 to address the lack of infrastructure in urban India?

options.text: Integrated Development of Small & Medium Towns
Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation
Jawaharlal Nehru National Urban Renewal Mission

answer: Jawaharlal Nehru National Urban Renewal Mission

solution.content: Jawaharlal Nehru National Urban Renewal Mission (JNNURM) - A massive city-modernization scheme launched by the Government of India under the Ministry of Urban Development. Launched December 2005. Closed - 2014.

question.content: When was the National Urban Health Mission approved by the Government of India?

solution.content: 2013. The National Urban Health Mission (NUHM): Launched by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.

question.content: What is the age criteria for the subscribers of Atal Pension Yojana?

solution.content: 18-40 Years. Atal Pension Yojana - Launched in 2015 under Ministry of Finance and administered by Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA), mainly focused on providing old age security to the unorganized workers. A minimum guaranteed pension for the subscribers ranging between Rs.1000 Rs. 5000, depending upon his contribution, at the age of 60 years. Other pension schemes for senior citizens - National Pension System (2004), Pradhan Mantri Vaya Vandana Yojana (2017), National Social Assistance Programme (1995).

question.content: Under the PL 480 scheme, India used to import wheat from which country

solution.content: USA. After independence, India relied on food crop supplies from the United States under Public Law 480 (PL-480) against rupee payments.

question.content: In which year was the 'Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana' launched?

solution.content: 2015. Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana: promotes skill development in the country by providing free short-duration skill training and incentivizes this by providing monetary rewards to youth for skill certification. Ministry - Skill Development and Entrepreneurship.

question.content: The 'Jal Kranti Abhiyan' was launched by which government during the financial year 2015-2016?

solution.content: Government of India. The Abhiyan was inaugurated by the Union Minister of Water Resources, River Development and Ganga Rejuvenation in Rajasthan in June 2015. Objective: Strengthening grass-root involvement of all stakeholders including Panchayati Raj institutions and local bodies for Participatory Irrigation Management.

question.content: Which of the following is a Disability Screening Mobile App developed by NCERT launched in Delhi schools to screen students with suspected disabilities?

solution.content: PRASHAST (Pre Assessment Holistic Screening Tool) - Launched (2022). This App will help in screening 21 disability conditions recognized in Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act 2016. Vidya Pravesh (2021): A 3 Months Play Based 'School Preparation Module'. Developed by NCERT. SAMAGRA It is a repository of digital resources of all subjects from class 1 to 12 covering syllabus. Developed by KITE (Kerala Infrastructure and Technology for Education) and SCERT (State Council of Educational Research and Training).

question.content: 'Swachh Bharat Mission' is associated with which public figure?

solution.content: Mahatma Gandhi. Swachh Bharat Mission (SBM) is a country-wide campaign initiated by the Government of India at Rajpath (New Delhi) on October 2, 2014 to eliminate open defecation and improve solid waste management.

question.content: How many engines drive 'PM Gati Shakti', a project launched by the central government with an aim to revolutionise infrastructure in India?

solution.content: Seven. Gati Shakti scheme (2021) or National Master Plan for multi-modal connectivity plan comes under the Ministry of Commerce.

question.content: What is the aim of the Annapurna Yojana of the Government of India?

options.text: To provide food grains to children
To provide food grains to women
To provide food grains to senior citizens

answer: To provide food grains to senior citizens

solution.content: . Annapurna Yojana Launched by the Ministry of Rural Development. It is a part of the National Social Assistance Programme (1995). Objective It provides Food Security to Senior Citizens above 60 years of age and to those eligible old-aged persons who remained uncovered under Indira Gandhi NOAPS (National Old Age Pension Scheme). Eligible beneficiaries will receive 10 kg (Every month) of grains free of charge.

question.content: Karmayogi Bharat owns and operates the digital assets and platforms for the onlinetraining of_

solution.content: Civil servants. Karmayogi Bharat: A Special Purpose Vehicle (set up under section 8 of Companies Act, 2013 as a 100% government-owned entity) which shall own, manage, maintain and improve the digital platform, IGOT (Integrated Govt. Online training) to implement Mission Karmayogi (2020) the National Programme for Civil Services Capacity Building.

question.content: The Pudhumai Penn scheme is launched by which state government?

solution.content: Tamil Nadu. The Pudhumai Penn scheme: Tamil Nadu Chief minister M K Stalin launched this Scheme on 5 September 2022. Aim : To enhance the enrolment ratio of girls from Government schools to Higher Education Institutions. Beneficiaries: Girl students studying from class VI to XIl in Government school. Benefits: ₹1000 will be deposited in the bank account of the girl student.

question.content: The National Rural Employment Programme was merged with in 1989.

solution.content: Jawahar Rozgar Yojana - It was launched in April 1989 by merging National Rural Employment Program (NREP) and Rural Landless Employment Guarantee Programme (RLEGP). It was replaced by Jawahar Gram Samridhi Yojna on 1 April 1999 and on 25 September 2001, merged with Sampoorna Grameen Rozgar Yojana. Indira Awaas Yojana (IAY) 1985-86 (Now replaced by Pradhan Mantri Gramin Awas Yojana).

question.content: Which state government launched the "Panchamrut Yojana"?

solution.content: Uttar Pradesh. The Panchamrut scheme seeks to reduce the production cost of sugarcane, as wellas increase productivity and the fertility of the land.

question.content: Pradhan Mantri Gramodaya Yojana was launched in

solution.content: 2000. Pradhan Mantri Gramodaya Yojana It was started to improve the lives of the rural poor population. Other important government scheme: National Social Assistance Programme (Launched on 15th August, 1995). Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana (Launched on 25th December, 2000). Saansad Adarsh Gram Yojana (October 2014). Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (launched in 2016).

question.content: The Central Government has recently launched the YUVA 2.0 Scheme. It is a mentoring programme for young and budding authors below the age of

solution.content: 30. YUVA 2.0 (Young, Upcoming and Versatile Authors) - It is the Part of India 75 Project (Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav) to promote reading, writing and book culture in the country. It was announced on 2nd October 2022 under The Ministry of Education, Department of Higher Education.

question.content: In MUDRA Yojana, what does 'M' stand for?

solution.content: Micro. MUDRA (Micro Units Development and Refinance Agency) Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana (PMMY) is a scheme launched by the Hon'ble Prime Minister on April 8, 2015 for providing loans up to 10 lakh to the non-corporate, non-farm small or micro enterprises. Three types of mudra loan products Tarun (above Rs 5 lakh and up to Rs10 lakh), Kishor (above Rs 50,000 and up to Rs 5 lakh), and Shishu (covering loans up to Rs 50,000).

question.content: PM Street Vendor's AtmaNirbhar Nidhi (PM SVANidhi) Scheme was launched by which ministry?

options.text: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs

answer: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs

solution.content: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs. The PM Street Vendor's Atma Nirbhar Nidhi (PM SVANidhi) launched on June 01, 2020. Aim Providing affordable Working Capital loans to street vendors to resume their livelihoods that have been adversely affected due to Covid-19 lockdown.

question.content: The government launched the Stand - Up India scheme to promote entrepreneurship among _  Disabled Individuals (b) Transgender community (c) Elderly Individuals (d) Women and SC/ST communities

solution.content: Women and SC/ST communities. Stand up India Scheme was launched on April 05, 2016. The scheme has been extended till 2025. Startup India: 2016. Objective: Promote innovation and entrepreneurship in India. Digital India: 2015.

question.content: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana- Urban was launched by which Union Ministry?

options.text: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs

answer: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs

solution.content: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs. It was launched on 25th June 2015. Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana Gramin (PMAY-G) - It was launched in June 2015 with the aim to provide 'Housing for All' by 2022 in rural areas

question.content: Which of the following programmes was launched in 1999?

options.text: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee scheme

solution.content: Swarnajayanti Gram Swarozgar Yojana. It is operative since 1st April 1999 in rural areas and was launched by the Ministry of Rural Development India. SGSY will focus on the vulnerable section and the rural poor. Accordingly the SC/ST will account for at least 50%, Women 40% and the disabled 3% of those assisted.

question.content: The Union Government's "PAHAL Scheme" is related to _

solution.content: LPG Subsidy. PAHAL (Pratyaksh Hanstantrit Labh) entered into Guinness Book of World Records (largest Direct Benefit Transfer of LPG), was launched on 01 June 2013 by the Ministry of Petroleum & Natural Gas.

question.content: The National Literacy Mission (NLM) was set up in

solution.content: с) 1988. The National Literacy Mission - It aimed to educate people in the age group of 15 - 35. The major aim of the programme is on the promotion of literacy among women, scheduled castes and tribes and backward classes.

question.content: The Chief Minister of which of the following states launched the second phase of Ladli Laxmi Scheme 2.0 in November 2022?

solution.content: Madhya Pradesh. Ladli Laxmi Scheme 2.0 - The financial assistance of Rs 25,000 will be given to the daughter after going to college after passing class 12th, which will help her in educating and choosing a career.

question.content: "PM POSHAN" Scheme implemented by which ministry?

solution.content: Ministry of Education. In 2021, the Union Cabinet approved the PM-POSHAN (Pradhan Mantri Poshan Shakti Nirman) for providing one hot cooked meal in Government and Government-aided schools. The scheme replaced the Mid-day Meal Scheme. The Mid Day Meal Scheme was started in India on 15th August 1995.

question.content: Which Union Ministry implements the "Saksham Anganwadi and Poshan 2.0" scheme?

options.text: Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food & Public Distribution
Ministry of Health and Family welfare
Ministry of Women and Child Development

answer: Ministry of Women and Child Development

solution.content: Ministry of Women and Child Development. Saksham Anganwadi and Poshan 2.0 is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme implemented by States/UTs providing a package of six services to all eligible beneficiaries, namely, children in the age group of 0-6 years, pregnant women and lactating mothers through the platform of Anganwadi Centres across the country.

question.content: Which Union Ministry is related to the Prime Minister's Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP)?

options.text: Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises

answer: Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises

solution.content: Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises. About PMEGP: Any entrepreneur who is above 18 is allowed to set up factories or units with the government aid upto 25 lakhs for manufacturing sector and ₹ 10 lakhs for business/service sector for his/her new venture.

question.content: Which road plan in India was the first attempt for the Road Development Programme between 1943-1963?

solution.content: Nagpur Road plan (1943 1963). Bombay road plan (1961-1981, Lucknow road plan (1981 - 2001).

question.content: In which of the following years was the Fit India Movement launched by the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, Gol?

solution.content: 2019. Fit India Movement was launched on the occasion of National Sports Day to make fitness an integral part of the daily lives of the people of India.

question.content: Smart cities and Academia Towards Action and Research (SAAR) scheme was launched by the

options.text: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs

answer: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs

solution.content: The Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs (MoHUA) launched the SAAR program under the Smart Cities Mission.

question.content: In which year was Soil Health Card launched in India to enable the farmers to apply appropriate recommended dosages of nutrients for crop production and improving soil health and its fertility?

solution.content: 2015 (Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare). Soil Health Card (SHC) is a printed report which contains nutrient status of soil with respect to 12 nutrients: pH, Electrical Conductivity (EC), Organic Carbon (OC), Nitrogen (N), Phosphorus (P), Potassium (K), Sulphur (S), Zinc (Zn), Boron (B), Iron (Fe), Manganese (Mn) and Copper (Cu) of farm holdings.

question.content: When was the Ayushman Bharat Digital Mission launched?

solution.content: 27 September 2021. Ayushman Bharat Digital Mission aims to provide digital health IDs for all Indian citizens to help hospitals, insurance firms, and citizens access health records electronically when required.

question.content: Which scheme is NOT proposed to be covered under the Pradhan Mantri Swasthya Suraksha Nidhi?

options.text: Ayushman Bharat - Health and Wellness Centres
Ayushman Bharat - Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana

solution.content: Rashtriya Swasthya Aashwasan Yojana (RSAY).

question.content: What is the name of the scheme proposed as a single non-lapsable reserve fund for a share of health from the proceeds of health and education cess?

options.text: Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Aarogya Yojana

solution.content: Pradhan Mantri Swasthya Suraksha Nidhi. It provides financial support to the flagship schemes such as Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana, Pradhan Mantri Swasthya Suraksha Yojana, and National Health Mission.

question.content: 'Surakshit Hum Surakshit Tum Abhiyan' was launched by which of the following institutions?

options.text: NITI Aayog and bill and Melinda Gates Foundation
Ministry of Women and Child Development and Piramal Foundation
Ministry of Women and Child Development and Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation

solution.content: NITI Aayog and Piramal Foundation. NITI stands for "National Institution for Transforming India" (2015). Its initiatives include "15-year road map", "7-year vision, strategy, and action plan", AMRUT, Digital India, Atal Innovation Mission.

question.content: Which ministry launched the 'Start-up India Seed Fund Scheme'?

options.text: Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship

solution.content: Ministry of Commerce and Industry. The Startup India Seed Fund Scheme aims to provide seed funding to startups through approved incubators across all sectors and areas. Launched by the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade under the Ministry of Commerce and Industry in 2021.

question.content: In which year was the Immunization Programme introduced in India as 'Expanded Programme of Immunization' (EPI) by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare?

solution.content: 1978. The Expanded Programme on Immunization (EPI) was started in India in 1978 with the objective to reduce morbidity and mortality from tetanus, poliomyelitis, diphtheria, pertussis, and childhood tuberculosis by providing immunization services to all eligible children and pregnant women by 1990.

question.content: Realizing the importance of maintaining the cleanliness of the water bodies, the Government of India passed the Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, to safeguard our water resources.
In which year was the 'Pradhan Mantri Annadata Aay Sanrakshan Abhiyan' (PM AASHA) launched by the Government of India?

solution.content: 2018. The 'Pradhan Mantri Annadata Aay Sanrakshan Abhiyan' (PM AASHA) was launched by the Government of India. Pradhan Mantri Annadata Aay SanraksHan Abhiyan (PM-AASHA) is an umbrella scheme aimed at ensuring remunerative prices to the farmers for their produce.

question.content: 'Mission Antyodaya' is a mission mode project envisaged by the:

solution.content: Ministry of Rural Development. Mission Antyodaya is a convergence and accountability framework aiming to bring optimum use and management of resources. It was adopted in the Union Budget 2017-18.

question.content: Which of the following schemes is aimed at helping accelerate the uptake of broadband internet services?

solution.content: PM-WANI. It will consist of elements such as Public Data Office (PDO), Public Data Office Aggregator (PDOA), App Provider and Central Registry.

question.content: 'Swasthya Sathi' scheme is the health insurance scheme that covers the entire population of which of the following states?

solution.content: West Bengal. Under this scheme, basic health insurance cover up to Rs 5 lakh is provided for both tertiary and secondary medical care for each family.

question.content: In which year was the Target Olympic Podium Scheme' ('TOPS') formulated by the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports?

solution.content: 2014. TOPS facilitates selected athletes with support staff and training personnel, sports psychologists, physiotherapists etc including direct financial support of 50,000 rupees per month.

question.content: In which year was National Mission for Clean Ganga (NMCG) registered as a society under the Societies Registration Act 1860?

solution.content: 2011. National Mission for Clean Ganga (NMCG) is the implementation wing of the National Ganga River Basin Authority (NGRBA).

question.content: When was the Jal Jeevan Mission launched by the Prime Minister, with the goal of 'Har Ghar Jal'?
'Per Drop More Crop' is the goal for which Government of India scheme?

solution.content: Per Drop More Crop is implemented by the Department of Agriculture Cooperation and Farmers' Welfare.

question.content: 'Nikshay Poshan Yojana' is a scheme introduced by the Government of India to provide nutritional support to _ patients.

solution.content: Tuberculosis. Nikshay Poshan Yojana is a government scheme in India to provide 500 rupees per month for tuberculosis patients to buy food.
